definition:
Let $S$ be a surface (an algebraic variety of dimenion $2$) defined over
an algebraically closed field $k$. The Néron-Severi group of $S$,
denoted by $\operatorname{NS}(S)$, is the group of Weil divisors on $S$
modulo algebraic equivalence of divisors (see parent entry).

The Néron-Severi group of a surface is a finitely generated abelian
group.
